stream_context.summary: Kaze spends the session gray-boxing and optimizing Course 15, a space-themed level featuring "space taxi" cars, parking lots and musical set-pieces, while answering chat questions about funding, legal strategy, team roles and technical hurdles.

development_findings.summary: Kaze is currently blocking out the final path in Course 15, adding fly-in "space taxi" platforms, a parking-lot set-piece and a gramophone/piano staircase to lead into the level’s black-hole exit.
development_findings.quote: "We are working on Space Taxi… we need to make platforms to reach that part… this jump here sucks, maybe we add an antenna—or no, let’s turn the gramophone into piano stairs."

development_findings.summary: Model budgets are aggressively reduced (e.g., flying car trimmed from 82 to 64 triangles) to avoid crashes caused by too many collision surfaces on real N64 hardware.
development_findings.quote: "Okay, we just have too many surface nodes, that makes sense… 64 triangles should be good."

development_findings.summary: An N64-only crash revealed by hardware testing was traced to the old ‘spawn_special_objects’ routine; temporary fixes include disabling collisions until a full rewrite.
Kaze adopts a new compromise dive mechanic—players may adjust direction mid-dive but lose speed after testers rejected a full lock-out.
development_findings.quote: "People hated it when you couldn’t steer at all, so now you can change direction but you lose your speed."

development_findings.summary: Biobak’s feedback led to scrapping a cryptic Yoshi boss and replacing it with ‘OctoYoshi,’ a tentacled Yoshi head that attacks from black holes; players heal tumours inside its mouth.
Static recompilation is being considered to ship a commercial, Nintendo-free PC version alongside the N64 ROM, with all Mario assets and leftover code removed.
development_findings.quote: "I was thinking using the static recompilation to release it on Steam… I would replace all Nintendo assets and kick out the last bit of Nintendo code."

development_findings.summary: Kaze experiments with retro-futuristic CRT props using moving-texture ‘shine’ tricks to simulate reflective gold on low-poly geometry.
Course 2 visual rework is in progress by Biobak; Course 3 analysis is mostly done and will be tackled after Biobak finishes.

context_findings.summary: Kaze is exhausted from producing “my longest video yet” but hopes the algorithm rewards it.
He avoids Kickstarter due to confusion over sales-tax laws: "I’m kind of scared of getting completely fucked."
As a father, he reports feeling neutral: "Eh, it’s fine. No strong feelings about it."
Believes the hub world is the most important element and will be built last to ensure perfection and secret density.
context_findings.quote: "The hub world ties everything together… if Mario 64 hadn’t had a hub world I don’t think anyone would have liked the game."

context_findings.summary: Shows skepticism toward hiring outside artists who lack N64-shader knowledge, fearing onboarding costs outweigh benefits.
context_findings.quote: "I’m a little worried I’ll spend so much time teaching him that he ends up costing more time than he saves."

context_findings.summary: Maintains extensive Git backups and fears hardware loss: "Whenever I leave my house I back up everything."
Expresses displeasure with Germany’s high taxes and appreciates Canada despite bilingual packaging.

biobak.summary: Currently reworking Course 2 art and gave critical feedback that the original Yoshi boss idea was too cryptic, prompting the new ‘OctoYoshi’ concept.

zeina.summary: Provided concept art for Shy-Guy taxi drivers and renewed a 48-month channel membership; casual on-stream banter highlights spouse dynamic.

key_stories.title: The Dive Steering Debate
key_stories.summary: Kaze removed directional control during dives to tighten physics, but testers revolted. He compromised by allowing steering only after speed is lost.
key_stories.challenge: Original change killed player freedom and angered testers.
key_stories.process: Tested build in Course 1 beta; gathered feedback; re-implemented limited steering.
key_stories.outcome: Accepted by community; mechanic now final.
key_stories.key_quote: People hated it when you couldn’t steer at all, so now you can change direction but you lose your speed.

key_stories.title: From Cryptic Boss to OctoYoshi
key_stories.summary: An initial, puzzle-heavy Yoshi boss was deemed confusing. Biobak suggested a tentacled Yoshi emerging from black holes, leading Kaze to pivot.
key_stories.challenge: Original design lacked clarity and engagement.
key_stories.process: Discussion with Biobak; reviewed sketches; brainstormed attack patterns.
key_stories.outcome: New OctoYoshi concept focused on clear tentacle and mouth-tumour mechanics.
key_stories.key_quote: He attacks out of black holes… maybe you have to jump into his mouth and destroy the tumors inside.

key_stories.title: Legal Path to Steam
key_stories.summary: Kaze wants a commercial release but must dodge Nintendo IP issues.
key_stories.challenge: Can’t ship Mario assets or code on Steam.
key_stories.process: Exploring static recompilation; plans full asset/code replacement.
key_stories.outcome: Tentative plan for dual release (N64 ROM + Steam build).
key_stories.key_quote: I would replace all Nintendo assets and kick out the last bit of Nintendo code.
